text: Added package dependencies readxl, stringr, dplyr, tidyr, rlang use_package() Added unit testing structure use_testthat(); created initial (toy) test use_test("hsr_extract_coefficients") Added README file usethis::use_readme_rmd() built default .md file build_readme() Added NEWS.md use_news_md() Added badges (anticipation): use_cran_badge(), use_coverage(), use_github_action("check-standard") Added logo (created hexmake + ChatGPT): use_logo() Started package website use_pkgdown() pkgdown::build_site() get initial site used usethis::use_pkgdown_github_pages() create GitHub Actions workflow update site commit/push. automatically configures GitHub (branch created Pages configured). need push site pkgdown stuff yet. code: * Added all FY mock reports to `extdata`. Used `rename_files("hsr_example", "hsr_mock_reports")` to rename the function to be more explicit. Changed all required areas to accomodate change.  # 11/5/2025  * Initialized package by creating repo here: https://github.com/centralstatz/readmit * Then created _New Folder from Git_ in Positron, cloning that repo * Then used `usethis::create_package(getwd())` to initialize package template * Added this file `DEVNOTES.md` to `.Rbuildignore` * Ran `usethis::use_r("hsr_extract_coefficients")` to create the packages first function, which extracts the list of model coefficients from a CMS Hospital Specific Report (HSR) for a specified cohort. Added argument checks. * Used `devtools::load_all()` to test it (works on locally downloaded report). * Did initial `devtools::check()` and got various warnings/notes, which is expected because nothing was configured yet. * Edited the `DESCRIPTION` file (with possibly to change over time as package evolves), and added MIT license with `usethis::use_mit_license()` * Added `roxygen2` documentation to function. Used `devtools::document()` to document it. Added `\dontrun` to roxygen for function as example doesn't work yet. Need to put external data in the package. * Still have warning/note as I haven't declared dependencies, so will do that soon.

title: Investigating a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR)
text: developer package, don’t access hospitals’ actual HSR’s, contain senstivie patient information (.e., PHI) thus publicly available. work mock reports CMS provides public meant mimick format hospital can expect report . just includes fake data. Note: CMS changed format Hospital-Specific Reports (HSRs) FY2026 (see ). current HSR functions support Excel-based formats FY2025. However, analysis strategies still relevant. Nevertheless, provide useful playground analyze mechanics program. ’ll start finding report hsr_mock_reports() function: Using arguments lists various mock files included package Entering one listed file names return complete path file packages location computer Now can use HSR path package functions. course, just point HSR analyzing hospital’s reports.
code: hsr_mock_reports() #> [1] "FY2019_HRRP_MockHSR.xlsx" "FY2020_HRRP_MockHSR.xlsx" #> [3] "FY2021_HRRP_MockHSR.xlsx" "FY2022_HRRP_MockHSR.xlsx" #> [5] "FY2023_HRRP_MockHSR.xlsx" "FY2024_HRRP_MockHSR.xlsx" #> [7] "FY2025_HRRP_MockHSR.xlsx" my_report <- hsr_mock_reports("FY2025_HRRP_MockHSR.xlsx") my_report #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/readmit/extdata/FY2025_HRRP_MockHSR.xlsx"

title: Investigating a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR)
text: overall payment penalty hospital receives weighted average penalities applied individual cohorts. details typically second table (tab) HSR, can import hsr_cohort_summary(): can , example, reconcile overall penalty amount based table: : cohort must least 25 discharges eligible , excess readmission ratio (ERR) must greater assigned peer group’s median ERR Find difference hospital’s ERR compared peer group median ERR measure volume patients condition treated hospital Sum contributions cohort Multiply neutrality modifier hsr_payment_summary() table ’s penalty computed, cohort summary level.
code: cohort_summary <- hsr_cohort_summary(my_report) cohort_summary #> # A tibble: 6 × 10 #>   `Measure [a]` `Number of Eligible Discharges [b]` Number of Readmissions Amo…¹ #>   <chr>                                       <dbl>                        <dbl> #> 1 AMI                                             2                            0 #> 2 COPD                                           18                            3 #> 3 HF                                             25                            2 #> 4 Pneumonia                                      32                            5 #> 5 CABG                                           NA                           NA #> 6 THA/TKA                                        45                            0 #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​`Number of Readmissions Among Eligible Discharges [c]` #> # ℹ 7 more variables: `Predicted Readmission Rate [d]` <dbl>, #> #   `Expected Readmission Rate [e]` <dbl>, #> #   `Excess Readmission Ratio (ERR) [f]` <dbl>, #> #   `Peer Group Median ERR [g]` <dbl>, `Penalty Indicator (Yes/No) [h]` <chr>, #> #   `Ratio of DRG Payments Per Measure to Total Payments [i]` <dbl>, #> #   `National Observed Readmission Rate [j]` <dbl> cohort_summary |>    # Filter to cohorts with a penalty   dplyr::filter(`Penalty Indicator (Yes/No) [h]` == "Yes") |>      # Compute the contribution of each penalized cohort   dplyr::mutate(     Contribution =        `Ratio of DRG Payments Per Measure to Total Payments [i]` *       (         `Excess Readmission Ratio (ERR) [f]` -            `Peer Group Median ERR [g]`       )   ) |>      # Roll up into final calculation   dplyr::summarize(     Penalty = sum(Contribution) * hsr_neutrality_modifier(my_report)   ) #> # A tibble: 1 × 1 #>    Penalty #>      <dbl> #> 1 0.000746

title: Investigating a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR)
text: Note: using mock reports, dates files erroneous thus R doesn’t interpret dates. However, hospital report real dates thus R automatically parse . HSR also contains discharge-level data individual patients actually contributed program. separate table/tab cohorts. can use hsr_discharges() function import specified cohort: get patient identifying information, including specific dates associated index readmission hospitalizations, whether readmission occurred hospital, diagnosis codes, etc., valuable information can explore gain insights (’ll later). also options available function refine result:
code: hsr_discharges(my_report, "COPD") #> # A tibble: 21 × 17 #>    `ID Number` MBI         `Medical Record Number` `Beneficiary DOB` #>          <int> <chr>       <chr>                   <chr>             #>  1           1 9AA9AA9AA99 99999A                  99/99/9999        #>  2           2 9AA9AA9AA99 99999A                  99/99/9999        #>  3           3 9AA9AA9AA99 99999A                  99/99/9999        #>  4           4 9AA9AA9AA99 99999A                  99/99/9999        #>  5           5 9AA9AA9AA99 99999A                  99/99/9999        #>  6           6 9AA9AA9AA99 99999A                  99/99/9999        #>  7           7 9AA9AA9AA99 99999A                  99/99/9999        #>  8           8 9AA9AA9AA99 99999A                  99/99/9999        #>  9           9 9AA9AA9AA99 99999A                  99/99/9999        #> 10          10 9AA9AA9AA99 99999A                  99/99/9999        #> # ℹ 11 more rows #> # ℹ 13 more variables: `Admission Date of Index Stay` <chr>, #> #   `Discharge Date of Index Stay` <chr>, #> #   `Cohort Inclusion/Exclusion Indicator` <chr>, `Index Stay (Yes/No)` <chr>, #> #   `Principal Discharge Diagnosis of Index Stay` <chr>, #> #   `Discharge Destination` <chr>, #> #   `Unplanned Readmission within 30 Days (Yes/No) [a]` <chr>, …

title: Investigating a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR)
text: ERR calculated based aggregated roll individual adjusted readmission risks derived random-intercept logistic regression model. first row discharge table contains coefficients model. can use hsr_coefficients() function extract : allows us things like assess relative contribution risk factors estimated readmission rates use risk factor dataset compute individual level readmission risks.

title: Tools for Working with Hospital Readmissions Data
text: readmit evolving R package contains tools working analyzing hospital readmissions data. Currently, provides utilities components Hospital Readmissions Reduction Program (HRRP), including program timeline functions, Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) helpers, general importing tools Provider Data Catalog (PDC).

title: Tools for Working with Hospital Readmissions Data
text: can install development version readmit GitHub :
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("centralstatz/readmit")

title: Tools for Working with Hospital Readmissions Data
text: readmission occurs patient admitted hospital, , recently discharged (30 days typical time frame used hospitalizations). First foremost, obvious burden patients multiple reasons (.e., psychologically, financially, etc.). Additionally, hospitals across United States penalized Centers Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) annual basis called Hospital Readmissions Reduction Program (HRRP). program, 3% Medicare reimbursement witheld hospitals duration fiscal year depending volume excess readmissions select patient populations preceding performance period. Readmissions also show payer contracts, commericial insurers. Thus, key area focus hospitals part general measure overall health clinical financial operations. Typically, cross-functional teams deployed within health systems monitor develop initiatives, interventions, overall strategy manage prevent readmissions. includes things like care coordination patient outreach, well incorporate technology predictive analytics identify high-risk patients prevent readmissions occur.

what: Importing data from the Provider Data Catalog
title: Tools for Working with Hospital Readmissions Data
text: CMS provides access large repository datasets Provider Data Catalog (PDC), includes, among many datasets, readmission measures HRRP program results hospitals around United States. package functions prefixed like pdc_* general functions explore import metadata/datasets straight website clean datasets R (see ?pdc_read). example, can use pdc_topics() get collection topics seen : can choose topic (topics) want find datasets , extract metadata pdc_datasets(): result contains information datasets included Hospitals topic. can explore list find dataset want import. example, can search titles datasets relevant readmissions: find dataset want, can take note datasetid, use pdc_read() function import : can use dataset analysis. example: “many hospitals dataset located Wisconsin?”

title: Find relevant dates from the Hospital Readmissions Reduction Program (HRRP) — hrrp_get_dates
code: my_date <- as.Date("2022-01-01")  # What are the payment periods for this discharge? hrrp_get_dates(my_date, period = "payment", discharge = TRUE) #> # A tibble: 3 × 3 #>   ProgramYear StartDate  EndDate    #>         <int> <date>     <date>     #> 1        2026 2025-10-01 2026-09-30 #> 2        2025 2024-10-01 2025-09-30 #> 3        2024 2023-10-01 2024-09-30  # What performance periods is this discharge included in? hrrp_get_dates(my_date, period = "performance", discharge = TRUE) #> # A tibble: 4 × 3 #>   ProgramYear StartDate  EndDate    #>         <dbl> <chr>      <chr>      #> 1        2026 2021-07-01 2024-06-30 #> 2        2025 2020-07-01 2023-06-30 #> 3        2024 2019-07-01 2019-12-01 #> 4        2024 2020-07-01 2022-06-30  # What is the payment period overlapping this date? hrrp_get_dates(my_date, period = "payment", discharge = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   ProgramYear StartDate  EndDate    #>         <int> <date>     <date>     #> 1        2022 2021-10-01 2022-09-30  # What is the performance period whose penalty period overlaps this date? hrrp_get_dates(my_date, period = "performance", discharge = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   ProgramYear StartDate  EndDate    #>         <dbl> <chr>      <chr>      #> 1        2022 2017-07-01 2019-12-01  # What is the performance period for current penalty enforcement? hrrp_get_dates(Sys.Date(), period = "performance", discharge = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   ProgramYear StartDate  EndDate    #>         <dbl> <chr>      <chr>      #> 1        2026 2021-07-01 2024-06-30

title: Retrieve file location of mock Hospital-Specific Reports (HSR) — hsr_mock_reports
text: Provides location mock HSRs downloaded QualityNet come package users can import. files representation hospital's real report looks like received CMS. contain mock data sensitive fields (discharge level data, etc.), real data national level results (e.g., model coefficients). Thus, gives user ability practice/explore package functions translate hospital reports. Files include fiscal years (FY) 2019-2025 downloaded 11/8/2025 https://qualitynet.cms.gov/inpatient/hrrp/reports. File names changed better identifiability. text: file File path report cohort Cohort compute readmission risks . One c("AMI", "COPD", "HF", "PN", "CABG", "HK")

title: Compute discharge-level readmission risks in a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_readmission_risks
text: tibble::tibble() containing following columns: ID Number: unique discharge identifier (see hsr_discharges()) Predicted: predicted readmission risk discharge Expected: expected readmission risk discharge

title: Compute discharge-level readmission risks in a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_readmission_risks
text: readmission measure CMS uses grade performance Hospital Readmissions Reduction Program (HRRP). Individual discharges assigned adjusted readmission risk (based clinical history), get aggregated hospital-level score compared peer groups penalty determination. Specifically, random-intercept logistic regression model built cohort (see methodology) serves basis two (2) readmission risks assigned discharge: Predicted: Adjusted patient-specific clinical factors plus hospital-specific effect (random intercept term) Expected: Adjusted patient-specific clinical factors plus hospital-average effect quantities aggregated across discharges ratio taken form Excess Readmission Ratio (ERR), used cohort-specific comparison metric. Thus, comparative measure likely patients readmitted hospital versus average hospital, given hospital's clinical characteristics.

title: Compute discharge-level readmission risks in a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_readmission_risks
code: # Access a report my_report <- hsr_mock_reports("FY2025_HRRP_MockHSR.xlsx")  # Compute readmission risks for HF discharges hf_risks <- hsr_readmission_risks(my_report, "HF") hf_risks #> # A tibble: 25 × 3 #>    `ID Number` Predicted Expected #>          <int>     <dbl>    <dbl> #>  1           1    0.258    0.264  #>  2           2    0.186    0.192  #>  3           3    0.184    0.189  #>  4           4    0.188    0.193  #>  5           5    0.0857   0.0885 #>  6           6    0.133    0.138  #>  7           7    0.110    0.113  #>  8           8    0.183    0.188  #>  9           9    0.163    0.168  #> 10          10    0.179    0.184  #> # ℹ 15 more rows  # Compute the ERR from scratch hf_risks |>  dplyr::summarize(    Discharges = dplyr::n(),    Predicted = mean(Predicted),    Expected = mean(Expected),    ERR = Predicted / Expected  ) #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   Discharges Predicted Expected   ERR #>        <int>     <dbl>    <dbl> <dbl> #> 1         25     0.159    0.164 0.971   # Check that this matches the report table hsr_cohort_summary(my_report) |>  dplyr::select(   dplyr::matches(      paste0(        "^Measure|",        "^Number of Eligible Discharges|",        "^Predicted|",        "^Expected|",        "^Excess"      )    )  ) #> # A tibble: 6 × 5 #>   `Measure [a]` `Number of Eligible Discharges [b]` Predicted Readmission Rate…¹ #>   <chr>                                       <dbl>                        <dbl> #> 1 AMI                                             2                       0.181  #> 2 COPD                                           18                       0.165  #> 3 HF                                             25                       0.159  #> 4 Pneumonia                                      32                       0.142  #> 5 CABG                                           NA                      NA      #> 6 THA/TKA                                        45                       0.0350 #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​`Predicted Readmission Rate [d]` #> # ℹ 2 more variables: `Expected Readmission Rate [e]` <dbl>, #> #   `Excess Readmission Ratio (ERR) [f]` <dbl>

what: readmit: Tools for Working with Hospital Readmissions Data — readmit-package
title: readmit: Tools for Working with Hospital Readmissions Data — readmit-package
text: Contains tools working analyzing hospital readmissions data. package provides utilities components Hospital Readmissions Reduction Program (HRRP), including program timeline functions, Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) helpers, general importing tools Provider Data Catalog (PDC).
